NPaOGKIk--IyFZJ0OXZJ7w.text: I am on a quest in Edinburgh to find the best scones around. The sheer size of the scones at Papii is exactly what drew me in.  Overall, this was a decent scone. Decent price, came with a huge serving of clotted cream and jam.  On a side note, highly recommend the iced tea for those rare Scottish summer days.

photos.caption: Photo of Papii - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

tGgnA9J8bQbwdWijJ3FmHQ.text: Best breakfast I've had in a while. Their salmon eggs were as amazing as the spinach ones. We also tried the Salmon bagel which was as tasty. And we ended the breakfast by sharing strawberry waffles, which were a very yummy surprise. They had no problem splitting everything up in separate plates so we could all share. We also were a bit late, but the girl there was sweet enough to move some table and accommodate for our group :)

photos.caption: Photo of Papii - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Salmon Bagel
Photo of Papii - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Poached eggs with Salmon

eXUwO2tMAVzVLiyLOSiVHQ.text: Had to walk 18 minutes from old town to get here, but it was definitely worth it! This has been the best breakfast that I have eaten while in Edinburgh. Eggs Benedict were superb and so were the strawberry waffles and breakfast roll. Price is well worth it and the staff does Scotland a great deal of justice; they are friendly and knowledgeable. Make sure to stop by when in Edinburgh.

yWBoQ6gYYidpOoNBy27hHg.text: Waffles as big as your head (bigger than some), pretty cakes, warm and cosy setting. This is a central cafe of which the clientele are both tourists and locals.   The seating is a little awkward. My friend and I awkwardly have a "I am more polite than you battle" waiting to sit down, who takes the comfortable seat with a back rest or who puts up with the stool?  We both opted for soya cappuccino... and counteracted the dairy free goodness with those massive waffles. I can't remember the exact price, between 5-6. It seemed steep but the portion size was more than decent. We could have easily shared one! I got a maple syrup and strawberry waffle whilst my friend took one with cream, banana and honey. The waffle itself was a bit dry but the maple syrup was also poured quite liberally. The coffee was very good (artisan roast) and the soya milk wasn't curdle, sign of a True barista.   I would probably return if it were in my part of town.

V8YMBeoClD5OfWiJv2QqqA.text: I love this place. It has a cozy feel, and the best smoothies I've had yet in Edinburgh. The sandwiches are delicious AND they have nutella croissants... Can't get much better than that. No wifi. Pretty quiet. Great and friendly staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Papii - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Nutella croissant
Photo of Papii - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Smoothie

J_jkzyW4VOnnYg5Zo7KBqg.text: Went here with a craving for waffles, was not disappointed! My soy latte was also very good, it's really difficult finding cafes that don't burn the soy milk, so Papii gets an A* for that!

photos.caption: Photo of Papii - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

7fyIfkyiu7NEAWD4o86AKg.text: Love this place. The salmon bagel is the best. Husband got the waffle and he lived it. Dishes and coffee was well presented. Wife had been wanting to go back,  but they close too early. We'll have to get there early in the morning before we leave town.

photos.caption: Photo of Papii - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Papii - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

1KV_cR9Bp-09r7VSyqiJiw.text: Great tiny place for a great breakfast! I had the waffles which were good and covered in a mountain of bacon. I ordered the flat white codes which was extremely strong but I'm guessing I only think that because I'm American and our coffee is clearly weak compared to here.

yH5jQ0WiFX_aLlcqNZ4bjQ.text: A cute little cafe in new town. Excellent smoothies and waffles and even though there were a lot of people and not a lot of tables we still ended up being able to get a spot. It does seem a bit understaffed by how popular it is but the two there did a great job. I would definitely visit again if I'm ever in Edinburgh.

aHor_GrpwU1H3AXvpD5f0w.text: Came here for lunch and the Cajun Chicken Panini and smoothie was deliciously. Lovely little place and staff were friendly and welcoming. Their breakfast menu looks great too - will definitely return when next in Edinburgh

photos.caption: Photo of Papii - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

c8Ukb7PaS7XwyBwqlDiN-Q.text: Had a quick breakfast before work and everything was spot on- perfect flat white, loads of crispy bacon and vanilla buttermilk waffles. Service friendly as always. Thumbs up all round!

photos.caption: Photo of Papii - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Papii - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Papii - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

KR4BuExChy4JwzooqP1Z7Q.text: Waffles. HUGE waffles. All day.  Tiny place but didn't disappoint. Probably better to go on a weekday as I cannot imagine finding a table during the weekend. Very easy to miss among the New Town chaos if you don't know what's waiting for you inside. I say give it a go. My smoothie was amazing, I thought a bit overpriced but it was served in a fairly big jar. Service was fast and very friendly. Will definitely come back!

YLY0HHh_LIDVV0FYAwJ8dQ.text: The best place I ate for breakfast in Edinburgh. The staff was so friendly and so attentive. I wish I knew about this place on Day 1, I would have come back every day. My friends and I had the double stuffed roll, eggs benedicts and the strawberry & honey waffle. I want to come again.

FktFA1jYApmwRTGzABeALg.text: Lovely place, very kind and happy staff. Exellent food and coffee. We tried to find proper breakfast before our train was leaving, and ended up here. Thank godness we did. This is the kind of place you would like to see in every town and city, and kinda hope you would be the only one to know about it, just so you could have it all to yourself. Five stars!

y8bhtbRbhdawP_XrIbcu7w.text: Having read the positive reviews on here about Papii, I deemed it safe to take my Bestie there when she was up from London.. she's rather a 'foodie' and I try to plan our eating adventures when she comes to visit.  We were not disappointed! Coffee was good (we're Kiwi, so we're about as snobby as you can be when it comes to coffee). Food was fabulous, although our second order of waffles came looking slightly anemic compared to my first order. This inconsistency is the only thing stopping me giving it a 5 star review.  There was only one guy behind the counter and he was slammed having apparently let the other girl go after a quiet morning.. Service however was still good.. We got our food in a timely manner although not all at the same time, but that didn't really bother us. We were impressed with everything we ate, which seemed like loads... as we decided to share a scone... then a brownie... on top of everything we'd ordered for brunch... We sat in the corner for a couple of hours hiding from the lashing rain and nomming of deliciousness!  Love the decor too... If only it was closer to home I'd be there every weekend!

JCsBtH7OWr221BdhHMR3OA.text: I spied this little lunch joint after a leisurely stroll back from Stockbridge and took note. I returned out of intrigue..... and the fact it advertises waffles?!!? I love waffles.  It is pretty small inside, a few tables and window seats, but it is nicely decorated with old window shutters painted in a selection of pastel colours which I liked! The service was good, they were very friendly and seem pretty happy to make up whatever you like. It is the usual soups, sandwiches, paninis, but they also have some pasta and filo pie dishes which sounded delicious and make a nice change!  I ended up going for a cajun chicken panini with roasted peppers and emmental. One of the best things about this place I would say is..... they do not scrimp on the fillings, they jam in as much as they can which is brilliant! My panini was lovely, as were my two coffees - artisan roast everyone! Another gold star for that!  The price was also pretty reasonable considering I have paid 6 in town for JUST a panini to sit in, whereas here I had two coffees aswell and it came to less than 7. I will pop in again when I am in the area to try the smoothies and waffles..... they sound heavenly!

Ak9G1ntnXv-k_3Di0s0obw.text: Really enjoyed my visit to Papii, the other day. Their lunchtime deals offer good value and nice quality.  Overall, we said: "I was really pleased with Papii. It was a significant upgrade on its near neighbour, P.O.S.H, both in terms of the look of the place and in terms of the quality of the product on offer. Next time I'm looking for a snacky sit-in lunch in this part of town, I look forward to stopping and sampling Papii's coffee, relaxing in the calm surroundings, and trying some more dishes from their menu."

yOpB8I9Uo6JTY11DNnCw4w.text: papii has a welcoming crisp white frontage and almost summery feel inside with friendly, welcoming staff. they're kid friendly with baby changing facilities in the loo. they've a variety of wholesome looking food to choose from. the pasta and potato bakes looked particularly good but smoothies, breakfast, soups and cakes were also available. papii use artisan roast coffee. we had a double shot flat white and cappuccino (single shot). The milk was a wee bit hot and milk texture a bit thin but the flavour was fulsome and rounded, thanks to using great quality coffee. edinburghcoffeelovers.bl... twitter: @edinburghcoffee

photos.caption: Photo of Papii - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Papii - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Papii - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

rBF0SvDlkAMTfev-EwPMrQ.text: This place is so yummy!!! It's a very small, cost spot with around 10 tables... we came for a late breakfast around 12pm so it wasn't that full we only had to wait around 10 mins to sit.   We ordered egg Benedict's and the waffle with strawberries and bacon. Both were spectacular!! The egg Benedicts were hot, and juicy. The yolk was runny and the bacon was so crispy! It was amazing! The sauce on top was so perfect, it had some pepper on top that really hit the spot.   The waffles were crispy, which I love, there was a generous amount of bacon and strawberries. All around amazing breakfast we didn't leave one thing on our plate.   The prices are fair and the service was perfect.   I loved the cute cosy spot!! Must try!!

photos.caption: Photo of Papii - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

YH18TVTSvB0TjH1dqNjvTg.text: Cute little deli right by our flat. Awesome food and awesome environment. Good prices too

FiPBg5qtKTVhMle0bLWZkw.text: Lovely casual and intimate place with a fun and warm atmosphere, playful and tasty waffles!

photos.caption: Photo of Papii - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Bacon strawberries waffle with a succulent lightly smoked bacon

UEqblSAORFtxTqFfgvKoRw.text: STREAKY BACON. Everything on Papii's breakfast/brunch menu is amazing. The only thing that could make it better is extra streaky bacon, which I haven't found anywhere else in Edinburgh. Whether you're ordering eggs Benedict, Waffles...or water...order a side of extra streaky bacon.

M2Xo0yUjUq3RwonHOD-6wA.text: What a gem! Little cozy spot... Reasonable prices, flavorful entrees and fare with great service. Everything was so fresh! Come early, they tend to run out of items, they are that good!  We came hungry and left satisfied.  -Cappuccinos tasty -sandwiches filling. I ordered the salami, yum! It didn't taste salty, bonus! My husband ordered the chicken sandwich, he was satisfied.  Both were great choices. The bread was so fresh! They do have a meal deal: sandwich, chips and drink.  -spanakopita!!! Omg! It was honesty the best I ever had! Large portions though... oh well, more for me!   If we are ever back in the area, we would definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Papii - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Papii - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Love the decor
Photo of Papii - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Spanakopita, delicious!

O4WCoVBvePgnOdqN_RB3hg.text: Cute little spot in Edinburgh, cozy little interior with very limited seating but found the food to be creative and delicious......worth a trip!

Mi_CezSUoG9exdt0sKujcg.text: Extremely impolite. We came as a party of 5 and the host told us to wait outside the cafe for 40 minutes even though there are plenty of seats available. While we were waiting in the cold winds of Edinburgh, the host allowed a group that came later than us to sit first (we already told her that we can split tables). After we sat down, the host was very indifferent when we told her that we are ready to order, and she even rolled her eyes. With this kind of service, it really doesn't matter how the food is. There are plenty of brunch places nearby, so I don't recommend coming in this cafe.

q_mtT3BeOqAGJriTcDwqqA.text: Didn't deserve a penny of tips with this kind of indifference stupid serving attitude. If you saw this review, go find any other cafe, I'm sure it would be better than this one. No kiddin:(

v4h3dT9P6Rp0H_pUBBSxUw.text: Dined in this place during 'peak hour'. Their attitude is particularly upsetting especially the Asian staff, who's really got an attitude. If you are looking for a place with attitude, here is the place.

BTp_d120Pw8GXVcQ35OAhw.text: Latte and banana waffles were great, although cream is not freshly made, we were told it's from a can. I will preface the next review by saying I have eaten Eggs Benedict in restaurants all over the world my entire adult life. That being said, I requested my whites be cooked well, as the previous morning I was served mucous eggs at a different place. My eggs came out hard boiled. I was asked if they were ok. I didn't want to cause an issue, so I didn't complain. The dish came out dry with a one ounce (think half a shot glass) side of cold Hollandaise sauce. I requested more, was given a bit larger portion, cold as well. I then asked for warm sauce and was told they don't heat it or it will curdle. This indicates it's not freshly made. Since when is cold hollandaise sauce the standard? Also, no WiFi and they charge $1.00 more per dish and item if you eat in.

Gc_0jHFOHDlL-OnAqiU9xQ.text: Lovely place!Really fresh fruits and great taste! Recommend bacon waffle and strawberry waffle!

photos.caption: Photo of Papii - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Papii - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Papii - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

1p2G3RTNQNuV189oI-Jt3A.text: Essentially the best breakfast I've ever had! Maple bacon piled high on crispy waffles, with a side of poached eggs. Perfect cup of Cappuccino too Thanks Scotland, I needed that!

photos.caption: Photo of Papii - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Papii - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

MudS8YEyPbhEh8eYN5G_fw.text: Very nice folks, super breakfast food. I had Benedict with salmon (Royale) and were very good. Scones are good as well. Highly recommended

7t-w6msBBD9_niS41_EXWg.text: In Edinburgh for the weekend and had no idea what to do... so what does every average person do when they have that problem? I found this cute and quint little place on Google. The reviews and ratings were good and everything here was locally sourced so count me in!  The place is small, it can be easily missed when walking to it. Also, so if you are trying to come here with a group larger than 2, you may have to wait but I think it would be worth it. The staff is genuinely cheery and very polite and kind. The inside is very homey with mixed matched tables, chairs and couches, but you really don't feel crowded in.   I had a latte and the breakfast panini. The coffee was awesome, not bitter, smooth and creamy, one of the best lattes I have had. I even took another one to go. The panini was delicious as well. Free range hard boiled egg sliced up, bacon, melted mozzarella and hollandaise. The hollandaise was the best part and made the sandwich.  Great little nook in Edinburgh, if I end up back here I will definitely come back. The only downsides are being small and busy, but if you aren't in a rush and want to enjoy a really awesome breakfast, definitely try this place.

ane2PTl45A-dGM8aDVdQ_w.text: This is a small cafe in the city centre offering a decent range of breakfast options. From breakfast rolls, egg dishes and paninis to waffles.  We tried their eggs royale, waffles, breakfast panini and, because it caught my eye in the fridge, spanikopita. This was served warm with dressed and seasoned salad. All food was very tasty, fresh and wonderfully hot.  Coffees and chai latte were good too and the service was excellent.  This cafe needs attention both outside and parts of the inside. But don't let that deter you from this solid breakfast spot.

4nFHTKaBAerEG-JfOf5kiw.text: Great coffee shop with good breakfast options. The Eggs Benedict (with bacon, hame or salmon) was good and looked like a popular item. It was also a enjoyable atmosphere. Seating is limited and you may have some wait time before being seated, but great service once you get seated.

63-j0ALU1B5wDYZ0yAn1SQ.text: Amazing breakfast foods and coffee/cappuccino. Waffles were a big hit! We really enjoyed this quaint little spot on our vacation.

IwZoVpjNo_LWLBRySa9emQ.text: OH MA GOD. This place was incredible. Ordered a few things to share with friends, but the standout was the Crispy Bacon and Maple Syrup Waffles. First off, there was an ungodly amount of bacon on there, at least 10 strips, no joking, for only 6.15. If I was back in the US, that would be $25 for sure. The bacon was incredible and the waffles were crispy and perfect. 11/10 would recommend.

lp2QDEqjHWkufYgokSD5SQ.text: I had high hopes for Papii but left feeling disappointed.   I wanted a quick smoothie for my afternoon walk home. The guy on the till was on a trial shift so couldn't put through my sale without supervision. The lady on the shift with him saw me but carried out a few tasks, whilst I waited for her to take my order. I waited a few minutes, feeling like a bit of a lemon for doing so.  So, I'd ordered my smoothie. It was relatively quiet and I could see plenty of staff in the kitchen. I waited about ten minutes, often catching glimpses into the back to see staff joking around. - By the time my smoothie came, I wasn't too sure whether I wanted one anymore!  Finally, smoothie in hand, I thanked the lady and said goodbye. She turned sharply away from me to talk to her colleague, with no thank you or goodbye. And no apology for the wait. Service wise, I'd expected better.  I sipped the smoothie on my way home. It was berries and orange juice with coconut puree; the flavours didn't go well together. It was sour and the coconut puree also made it overly sweet. I'm working part time hours at the moment and a little strapped for cash so I regretted not saving the pennies and waiting till I'd gotten home to make my own. - Foodie regret is such an awful feeling! Unfortunately, Papii disappointed me with both its service and its smoothie.

dgT7WqG0fWQp6qn6LJVEeA.text: Oh good. Another great eggs benny place. My waistline really needed that one... Edinburgh, would you quit it with the amazing brunch options?   No. Don't. Please don't.   Yet another wonderful Elite suggested find, this time courtesy of the lovely Caz H. This tiny little place packs a surprising punch. It's all of six tables - which you will acutely feel on the weekend while you table scavenge with the ten other people looking to feed themselves. Expect to be squeezed in, table poached or on the rare occasion, exiled to the outside seats if you venture here on a weekend.  Why? Because you've made an excellent decision - they serve up a delightful breakfast. All. Freaking. Day.  Because i'm addicted, I had to go with a benny option, though the waffles here look pretty killer as well. Opted for a Eggs Royale (smoked salmon benny) and it was darn tasty. Alongside not one, but two coffees (you know it's good when this rare coffee consumer orders a second), it was a lovely little brunch for a decent price.  I had been in here once previously for a smoothie. Honestly, they aren't my favourite but I come from the land of smack-you-in-the-face-green-health-smoothies, so it was just too sweet for my likely. That being said, in the city, they're second only to Hula in this category. If you are a far less picky guy/gal and like a sweet fruit drink - this is likely a good option.  All in all, another lovely little find for my Sunday afternoons. Thanks Caz!

photos.caption: Photo of Papii - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Yeah! @papii representing the #YelpLove
Photo of Papii - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. BLT on baguette
Photo of Papii - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Cherry crush smoothie!
